meanings.def: to reduce something or to become less in value, quality, etc.
examples: lower something He lowered his voice to a whisper.
This drug is used to lower blood pressure.
to lower the rate/cost/price/level of something
Her voice lowered as she spoke.
The company may be forced to lower prices in order to stay competitive.
a proposal to lower the voting age to 16
The company has lowered its expectations for profits this year.
We are not prepared to lower our academic standards.
Mild exercise three times a week significantly lowers your risk of cancer.
The drives were allowed to idle until the temperatures lowered and stabilized.

meanings.def: to let or make something/somebody go down
examples: lower something He had to lower his head to get through the door.
She lowered her newspaper and looked around.
lower something/somebody + adv./prep. They lowered him down the cliff on a rope.
The coffin is lowered into the grave and covered with earth.
Cristina blushed and quickly lowered her eyes.
He carefully lowered the sleeping child onto the bed.
She lowered herself into the driver's seat.

meanings.def: to set a new, lower standard of quality or performance
examples: In the current economic climate we may need to lower the bar on quotas.

meanings.def: to behave in a way that makes other people respect you less
examples: I wouldn't lower myself by working for him.

meanings.def: to expect more/less from a situation
examples: If they can’t afford such a big house, they’ll just have to lower their sights a little.
After failing to get into university, he lowered his sights and got a job in a shop.

meanings.def: to increase/decrease the amount of excitement, emotion, etc. in a situation
examples: His angry refusal to agree raised the temperature of the meeting.
The government tried to lower the political temperature by agreeing to some of the demands.

meanings.def: located below something else, especially something of the same type, or the other of a pair
examples: the lower deck of a ship
His lower lip trembled.

meanings.def: at or near the bottom of something
examples: the mountain’s lower slopes
I have problems with my lower back.

meanings.def: located towards the coast, on low ground or towards the south of an area
examples: the lower reaches of the Nile

meanings.def: to be dark and show that bad weather is likely
examples: Huge clouds lowered over the bay.
